definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: The police and army were on patrol, firing into the air, as hundreds of people fled their homes.
sentences.chinese: 巡邏的警察和軍隊朝空中鳴槍，數百人逃離家園。

sentences.english: After the referee fired his gun, the long-distance running athletes began running.
sentences.chinese: 裁判鳴槍後，參加長跑的運動員們都跑了出去。

sentences.english: But what he DIDN’T tell me was that the starter gun only fired BLANKS.
sentences.chinese: 但是他忘記告訴我比賽開始的鳴槍只是放空槍。

sentences.english: They've been firing their guns into the air in exuberant celebration.
sentences.chinese: 他們對空鳴槍進行慶祝。

sentences.english: According to one report he fired a warning shot.
Police on patrol fired warning shots before shooting at the 3 suspects.
sentences.chinese: 民警鳴槍示警無效後依法開槍。

definition: Chaochou town in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
